intro: Scabiosa kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish ladies' mantle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iran. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators. Scabiosa kurdica is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
